feed.title: MidwestWeekends - Travel in Minnesota, Wisconsin, Illinois, Iowa
feed.subtitle: ... because life's too short to stay home

entry.title: Artistic Grand Marais
entry.content: On the shores of Lake Superior, this once-rugged village is a cultural outpost.

entry.title: Party in Milwaukee
entry.content: Summer is one long festival in this easygoing city on Lake Michigan.

entry.title: 10 great day trips around Milwaukee
entry.content: Ride trolleys, see lighthouses, spot birds and hike past mansions.

entry.title: Best of summer
entry.content: The best hiking, bicycling, canoeing, kayaking, wildlife-watching, backpacking, camping, shopping, cruising and train rides in the Upper Midwest.

entry.title: Baraboo's gilt complex
entry.content: In Ringlingville, the golden age of the circus never ended.

entry.title: Playtime in Milwaukee
entry.content: For children, this easygoing Wisconsin city is just the right size.

entry.title: Homes for the holidays
entry.content: For Christmas, historic mansions up the ante on opulence.

entry.title: Barn storming
entry.content: Driving tours in five states showcase these simple but cherished farm buildings.

entry.title: Agates in Moose Lake
entry.content: Every year in July, Moose Lake introduces budding rockhounds to the thrill of the hunt.

entry.title: America's freshwater Riviera
entry.content: On the gorgeous beaches of Wisconsin, Michigan, Indiana and Illinois, everyone can find a spot in the sun.

entry.title: Beaches of Minnesota's North Shore
entry.content: Agate-hunters, storm-watchers and picnickers all want to be close to the edge.

entry.title: Where eagles land
entry.content: Winter is anything but slow at the big birds' favorite gathering spots in Minnesota, Wisconsin, Iowa and Illinois.
